animalStyles.name: Spider
animalStyles.description: The Spider style in BJJ is characterized by the use of long limbs to control and submit opponents. Practitioners of this style excel at creating and maintaining distance, using their legs to control their opponent's arms and posture.
characteristics: Uses flexibility to create awkward angles
moveCurriculum: Closed Guard Posture Control - Inverted Armbar
Closed Guard Collar and Elbow Control - Triangle Choke
Open Guard: Double Wrist Control to Overhead Sweep
Open Guard vs Standing: Double Wrist Control to Tripod Sweep
Closed Guard Pin: Armbar Vs Two Handed Choke
Sliding Collar Choke (from back control)
Closed Guard Pin Escape vs Arm Between the Legs
Half Guard Pin: Guard Recovery

animalStyles.name: Gorilla
animalStyles.description: The Gorilla style in BJJ focuses on using strength and pressure to dominate opponents. Practitioners of this style often rely on powerful takedowns, crushing top pressure, and strength-based submissions.
moveCurriculum: Double Leg Takedown
Guard Passing: Leg Staple Pass
Half Guard: Pass to Mount (7 point pass)
Side Control to Mount Transition
Mount Top Overview
Knee on belly drills
Side Control: Kata Gatame (Head and Arm Choke)
Mount: Keylock (Americana / Shoulder Lock)
Mount: Ezekiel choke

animalStyles.name: Anaconda
animalStyles.description: The Anaconda style in BJJ emphasizes smooth, controlling movements and gradual constriction of the opponent. Practitioners of this style excel in maintaining dominant positions and applying steady pressure to wear down opponents.
characteristics: Specializes in chokes and constricting submissions
moveCurriculum: Snatch single leg (Outside leg finish)
Front Headlock Go Behind
Turtle Position to Back Mount
Sliding Collar Choke
Side Control: North South Choke
Mount: Kata Gatame (Head and arm choke)
Side Control to Mount Transition
Mount to Back Mount and Rear Naked Choke

animalStyles.name: Mongoose
animalStyles.description: The Mongoose style in BJJ is characterized by quick, agile movements and a high-energy approach. Practitioners of this style excel in creating and capitalizing on scrambles, often catching opponents off-guard with their speed.
moveCurriculum: Closed Guard vs Kneeling Posture: Hip Bump Sweep
Closed Guard vs Standing Posture: Handstand Sweep (Lumberjack Sweep)
Closed Guard vs Standing Posture: Handstand Sweep (Lumberjack Sweep) to Step-over Armbar
Standing High-elbow Guillotine
Knee on belly: Near Armbar
Knee on belly: Far Armbar
Mount: Elbow/Knee Escape
Side Control: Escape Head and Arm Control - Escape to the Knees, Single Leg

animalStyles.name: Bear
animalStyles.description: The Bear style in BJJ focuses on using heavy pressure and overwhelming force to control and submit opponents. Practitioners of this style often rely on their size and strength to maintain dominant positions and wear down their opponents.
characteristics: Excels in pin positions like side control and mount
moveCurriculum: Closed Guard Top: Stiff Arm Closed Guard Break
Guard Passing: Knee Cut Pass
Half Guard: Pass to Side Control (Knee Cut Pass)
Side Control: Kimura (Shoulder Lock) from Armbar (Head Side Arm Grip)
Mount: Armbar vs Instinctive Opp (vs lateral push)
Knee on belly: Cross Choke
Side Control: Kata Gatame (Head and Arm Choke)
Headlock on the Ground (Kesa Gatame) Overview

animalStyles.name: Octopus
animalStyles.description: The Octopus style in BJJ is characterized by a highly technical and diverse approach. Practitioners of this style are comfortable in various positions and excel at chaining techniques together fluidly.
characteristics: Highly adaptable and diverse skill set
moveCurriculum: Closed Guard Posture control with Head and Arm - Overview
Closed Guard Posture control with Head and Arm - Transition to Back Mount
Open Guard: Double Wrist Control to Overhead Sweep
Closed Guard Collar and Elbow Control - Shoulder Trap Armbar
Side Control: Armbar (Head Side Arm Grip)
Knee on belly: Far Armbar
Closed Guard vs Kneeling Posture: Flower Sweep
Turtle Position - Bottom: Guard Recovery Escape

animalStyles.name: Kangaroo
animalStyles.description: The Kangaroo style in BJJ is known for its explosive, dynamic movements and athletic approach. Practitioners of this style often use their agility and timing to catch opponents off-guard with spectacular techniques.
characteristics: Specializes in flying submissions and sweeps
moveCurriculum: Double Leg Takedown
Guard Passing: Leg Staple Pass
Closed Guard vs Kneeling Posture: Hip Bump Sweep
Standing High-elbow Guillotine
Mount: Armbar vs Instinctive Opp (vs vertical push)
Knee on belly: Near Armbar
Closed Guard vs Standing Posture: Handstand Sweep (Lumberjack Sweep) to Step-over Armbar
Turtle Position - Bottom: Guard Recovery Escape

animalStyles.name: Turtle
animalStyles.description: The Turtle style in BJJ focuses on defensive techniques and the ability to survive and escape from bad positions. Practitioners of this style excel at protecting themselves and creating opportunities from seemingly disadvantageous positions.
characteristics: Turns defensive positions into offensive opportunities
moveCurriculum: Turtle Position Overview
Closed Guard Posture Overview
Half Guard Pin: Guard Recovery
Side Control: Escape Head and Arm Control - Guard Recovery
Mount: Elbow/Knee Escape
North South Control: Spinning Escape (Elbows Inside)
Closed Guard Pin: Armbar Vs Two Handed Choke
Submission Defence: Closed Guard Guillotine

animalStyles.name: Shark
animalStyles.description: The Shark style in BJJ is characterized by an aggressive, submission-hunting approach. Practitioners of this style are always looking for the finish, often sacrificing position for submission attempts.
characteristics: Specializes in chokes and joint locks
moveCurriculum: Front Headlock Go Behind
Guard Passing Overview: Four Foundational Guard Passes
Side Control to Mount Transition
Side Control: North South Choke
Mount: Kata Gatame (Head and arm choke)
Knee on belly: Cross Choke
Standing High-elbow Guillotine
Closed Guard Collar and Elbow Control - Triangle Choke

animalStyles.name: Crab
animalStyles.description: The Crab style in BJJ specializes in leg locks and lower body submissions. Practitioners of this style are experts at entangling their opponents' legs and finding creative ways to attack the lower body.
characteristics: Excellent at creating and maintaining leg entanglements
Strong focus on lower body control
moveCurriculum: Single Leg Takedown variations
Open Guard vs Standing: Double Wrist Control to Tripod Sweep
Half Guard: Pass to Side Control (Knee Cut Pass) (defend against this)
Guard Top: Straight Foot Lock
Half Guard Pin: Guard Recovery (to set up leg entanglements)
Open Guard: Double Wrist Control to Overhead Sweep (to enter leg entanglements)
Knee on belly drills (for top control when leg locks fail)
Side Control: Escape Head and Arm Control - Escape to the Knees, Single Leg

animalStyles.name: Chameleon
animalStyles.description: The Chameleon style in BJJ is characterized by adaptability and the ability to use unexpected techniques. Practitioners of this style are comfortable in various positions and excel at catching opponents off-guard with surprising moves.
moveCurriculum: Closed Guard Over the Back Posture Control - Head Outside Attacks
Closed Guard vs Standing Posture: Handstand Sweep (Lumberjack Sweep) to Step-over Armbar
Turtle Position - Bottom: Guard Recovery Escape
Side Control: Kimura (Shoulder Lock) from Armbar (Head Side Arm Grip)
Mount: Armbar vs Instinctive Opp (vs vertical push)
Knee on belly: Near Armbar
Guard Passing Overview: Four Foundational Guard Passes
Mount to Back Mount and Rear Naked Choke

animalStyles.name: Sloth
animalStyles.description: The Sloth style in BJJ focuses on a slow, methodical approach with an emphasis on conserving energy and maintaining dominant positions. Practitioners of this style excel at wearing down opponents through consistent pressure and positional dominance.
characteristics: Wins by points or advantages rather than submissions
moveCurriculum: Closed Guard Posture Overview
Half Guard Pin: Guard Recovery
Turtle Position Overview
Closed Guard Top: Kneeling Guard Break
Guard Passing: Knee Cut Pass
Half Guard: Pass to Side Control (Knee Cut Pass)
Side Control to Mount Transition
Mount Top Overview

animalStyles.name: Wolverine
animalStyles.description: The Wolverine style in BJJ is characterized by relentless pressure and a grinding approach. Practitioners of this style excel at wearing down opponents through constant forward pressure and a never-give-up attitude.
moveCurriculum: Closed Guard Top: Stiff Arm Closed Guard Break
Guard Passing: Leg Staple Pass
Half Guard: Pass to Mount (7 point pass)
Side Control: Kata Gatame (Head and Arm Choke)
Mount: Ezekiel choke
Knee on belly: Cross Choke
Side Control to Mount Transition
Headlock on the Ground (Kesa Gatame) Overview

animalStyles.name: Eel
animalStyles.description: The Eel style in BJJ is characterized by slippery, elusive movements and an ability to escape from tight situations. Practitioners of this style excel in creating and exploiting scrambles, often frustrating opponents with their ability to slip out of bad positions.
characteristics: Highly elusive and hard to control
moveCurriculum: Closed Guard vs Kneeling Posture: Hip Bump Sweep
Open Guard: Double Wrist Control to Overhead Sweep
Turtle Position - Bottom: Guard Recovery Escape
Side Control: Escape Head and Arm Control - Back Door
Mount: Bridge Escape
North South Control: Pendulum Escape (Elbows Outside)
Front Headlock Go Behind
Knee on belly: Far Armbar

animalStyles.name: Python
animalStyles.description: The Python style in BJJ emphasizes gradual constriction and control of the opponent. Practitioners of this style excel at slowly breaking down their opponent's defenses and applying steady, increasing pressure until submission or positional dominance is achieved.
characteristics: Specializes in constricting holds and chokes
moveCurriculum: Closed Guard Posture control with Head and Arm - Overview
Side Control to Mount Transition
Turtle Position to Back Mount
Mount: Kata Gatame (Head and arm choke)
Sliding Collar Choke
Half Guard: Pass to Mount (7 point pass)
Side Control: North South Choke
Closed Guard Collar and Elbow Control - Triangle Choke

animalStyles.name: Honey Badger
animalStyles.description: The Honey Badger style in BJJ is characterized by relentless aggression and fearlessness. Practitioners of this style are known for their tenacity, willingness to engage in any position, and ability to push through adversity.
characteristics: Excels in scrambles and chaotic situations
moveCurriculum: Double Leg Takedown
Guard Passing: Leg Staple Pass
Standing High-elbow Guillotine
Front Headlock Go Behind
Mount: Ezekiel choke
Closed Guard vs Kneeling Posture: Hip Bump Sweep
Knee on belly drills
Side Control: Kata Gatame (Head and Arm Choke)

animalStyles.name: Fox
animalStyles.description: The Fox style in BJJ emphasizes cunning, strategy, and misdirection. Practitioners of this style are known for their ability to set traps, use feints effectively, and capitalize on their opponent's mistakes.
characteristics: Excels at creating and exploiting openings
moveCurriculum: Open Guard: Double Wrist Control to Overhead Sweep
Closed Guard Collar and Elbow Control - Triangle Choke
Closed Guard vs Standing Posture: Handstand Sweep (Lumberjack Sweep) to Step-over Armbar
Guard Passing Overview: Four Foundational Guard Passes
Side Control: Kimura (Shoulder Lock) from Armbar (Head Side Arm Grip)
Closed Guard Pin: Armbar Vs Two Handed Choke
Turtle Position - Bottom: Guard Recovery Escape
Mount to Back Mount and Rear Naked Choke

animalStyles.name: Elephant
animalStyles.description: The Elephant style in BJJ focuses on using superior size and weight distribution to control opponents. Practitioners of this style excel at applying heavy pressure from top positions and using their weight to exhaust opponents.
moveCurriculum: Closed Guard Top: Stiff Arm Closed Guard Break
Guard Passing: Knee Cut Pass
Half Guard: Pass to Mount (7 point pass)
Side Control to Mount Transition
Mount Top Overview
Knee on belly: Cross Choke
Headlock on the Ground (Kesa Gatame) Overview
Side Control: North South Choke
